elements.text: I'd like to add a random quote to my site, ideally another random quote would be selected during each page reload. I tried to do this with an

{{randomquote}}

--------------------------------- # Julia function hfun_randomquote() facts = [ "fact1", "fact2", "fact3" ] return rand(facts) end
This does populate the random quote field in the html, but it does not change on reload (locally on my computer). Is there any way to run custom code on page reload?

Thanks all, I just did it with Javascript!

```<div id="lead" class="lead"  style="font-style: italic;">
  <script>
    let facts = [
      'Our planet\'s sky glows blue!',
      'The Vatican has more popes per capita than anywhere else on Earth.',
      'There are more trees on Earth than there are stars in the Milky Way.',
      'Humans consume around 12 billion pounds of coffee per year.',
      'Earth is the only planet in our solar system with rainbows.',
      'Lots of computer chips have components smaller than the wavelength of visible light.',
      'The power your laptop uses could move 2 lbs of weight one foot and back, at least 5 times per second.',
      'That shooting star you saw could\'ve been astronaut poop!'
] 

let fact = facts[Math.floor(Math.random() * facts.length)];
            document.querySelector("#lead").    innerHTML = "<p>" + fact + "</p>" 
  </script>
</div>```
As a sidenote, if anyone has any fun facts, feel free to send em my way :slightly_smiling_face:
